page.title: 13BIOGRAPHY
page.content: MR.CORBY HAS LIVED IN BOZEAT ALL HIS LIFE AND WAS A BOY IN THE 1920'S.HE TOLD US ABOUT IT. HE WENT TO SCHOOL WHEN HE WAS 3, AT THE OLD SCHOOL IN CAMDEN SQUARE.THE TEACHERS WERE VERY STRICT IN THOSE DAYS.AS CHILDREN THEY WOULD PLAY WHIP AND TOP,HOOPS AND JACKS.HIS POCKET MONEY THEN WAS TWO FARTHINGS WHICH WOULD BUY HIM 2 OUNCES OF SWEETS. THE VILLAGE WAS MUCH SMALLER THEN AND EVERYBODY KNEW EACH OTHER.AT ONE TIME BOZEAT HAD A POPULATION OF 1100 AND 400 OF THEM WERE CALLED DRAGE. MR. CORBY LEFT SCHOOL AT 14,AND WENT TO WORK ON A FARM NEAR GRENDON.HE STARTED WORK AT 5.45a.m.AND FINISHED AT 5.00p.m.THERE USED TO BE A CINEMA. HE CAN REMEMBER THE NIGHT SOIL MAN, WHO CAME ROUND AT NIGHT TO EMPTY THE BUCKETS AND TAKE THEM TO THE TIN PITS
